intro: Eriolobus yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan eriolobus, is a flowering plant species native to China. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
